articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Chang Ik
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Chang Ik
Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Monday sent a wreath to the bier of Academician, Prof. and Dr. Kim Chang Ik, room chief at Kim Chaek University of Technology who is winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Inspects Industrial Field in Northern Area of DPRK
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Inspects Industrial Field in Northern Area of DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim inspected industrial sectors in North and South Hamgyong provinces of the country from June 23 to 25.
					 Touring the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, Ranam Coal Mining Machine Complex, Chongjin Steel Works, Puryong Alloy Steel Complex, Kyongsong Insulator Factory and the Komusan Cement Factory and Tanchon Port under construction, he acquainted himself in detail with production, technological updating and construction progress there.
					
					 The premier called consultative meetings at relevant units. The meetings focused on the matters to increase Juche iron and alloy steel production, improve the quality of steel and insulators, consolidate independence in production of ordered equipment and cement and build Tanchon Port on a modern line.
					
					Technical measures were taken there to supply in time raw and other materials and equipment needed for industrial establishments in the provinces entrusted with an important duty in carrying out General Secretary Kim Jong Il's plan for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Meets Chinese Delegation
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim had a talk with the Liaoning provincial party and government delegation of China Monday when it paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
					 The delegation is led by Chen Zhenggao, deputy secretary of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China and governor of the Liaoning Provincial People's Government. 
					
					 Present on the occasion were Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Hong Kil Nam, vice-chairman of the North Phyongan Provincial People's Committee, officials concerned and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai.
					
					 Chen said that the traditional China-DPRK friendship, provided by Chinese revolutionaries of elder generation and President Kim Il Sung, is now developing on a new higher stage.
					
					 The delegation witnessed the achievements made by the people of the DPRK while touring various places of it, he said, hoping that they would register greater success under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting Liaoning provincial party and government delegation of China.
					 The gift was handed to DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Monday by head of the delegation Chen Zhenggao, deputy secretary of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China and governor of the Liaoning Provincial People's Government.

articles.title: President of Czech Republic Hopes Better Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
President of Czech Republic Hopes Better Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The Czech Republic and the DPRK have long maintained the cooperative relations and I hope the bilateral relations would favorably develop in the future, too.
					 Vaclav Klaus, president of the Czech Republic, said this when receiving credentials from Ri Kwang Il, DPRK ambassador to the Czech Republic, on June 23.

articles.title: German President Hopes Everything Would Go Well in DPRK
articles.content:
German President Hopes Everything Would Go Well in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- German President Christian Wulff hoped everything would go well in the DPRK and its team would prove successful at the 2011Women's World Cup. 
					 He said this on Saturday when meeting Minister of Physical Culture and Sports of the DPRK Pak Myong Chol and his party on a visit to Germany to attend the opening ceremony of the World Cup.

articles.title: DPRK Taekwon-Do Players Win Popularity in US
articles.content:
DPRK Taekwon-Do Players Win Popularity in US
						
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, an exhibition group of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee visited the United States. It performed in Boston and New York on June 11 and 12 and in Delaware on June 14, winning applause from Americans and U.S.-resident Koreans.
					 In a special program about the performance, VOA said whenever players presented excellent techniques, the spectators gave a big hand to them.  
					
					 The well-performed demonstration reminded the spectators of a movie scene, VOA said. It created a great sensation among U.S. citizens and students.
					
					 Taekwon-Do, associated with the Korean people's wisdom and courage, drew much interest from American people, it added.
					
					 According to VOA, CNN and other media of the United States, Japan and south Korea were deeply concerned about the exhibition group's visit to the United States.

articles.title: Typhoon-5 Brings Strong Wind, Tidal Waves to DPRK
articles.content:
Typhoon-5 Brings Strong Wind, Tidal Waves to DPRK
						
Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Typhoon-5 Meari has caused strong wind and heavy rain in the DPRK, mainly west coastal areas.
					 15-22 m per second wind hit more than 20 areas including Haeju, Sariwon and Anju cities and Unryul, Ryongyon and Taedong counties from 06:00 Sunday to 15:00 Monday.
					
					 Kangwon Province, South and North Hwanghae provinces and Kaesong City had heavy rainfalls from 12:00 Saturday to 15:00 Monday, 209 mm in Kosong, 195 mm in Hoeyang and 194 mm in Pongchon.
					
					 Meanwhile, 20-61 cm tidal waves were observed in the sea off North and South Hamgyong and Kangwon provinces on Sunday and Monday.

articles.title: Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize Closes
articles.content:
Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize Closes
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The sports contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize closed with due ceremony in Wonsan, Kangwon Province on Sunday. It was opened on June 3 to mark the 74th anniversary of the victorious battle in Pochonbo.
					 Men and women of the April 25 Sports Team placed first in soccer (premier match) and basketball and volleyball games while men of the April 25 Sports Team and women of the Amnokgang Sports Team in table tennis (premier match).

articles.title: "Arirang" Preparations Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
"Arirang" Preparations Brisk in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", an annual event, are making headway in the DPRK.
					 The creative staff members are pooling their wisdom to improve the performance involving songs, dances, gymnastic movements and acrobatic pieces, along with sound and lighting.
					
					 Kim Ok Rim, a 25-year-old dancer of the Mansudae Art Troupe, told KCNA, "I am pleased to take part in the performance to be held amid great interest of world people. I will do my best in the performance, a masterpiece in the 21st century." 
					
					 Pang Un Gyong, a 20-year-old factory worker, says, "It is the first time for me to take part in the performance. I am not sure I will make a good job. But dance directors and my friends help me in training. This makes me confident of my acting."   
					
					 "Arirang" is based on events of weighty significance in the centenary history of the Korean nation. 
					
					It won diploma of the Guinness Book of World Records in Juche 96 (2007). 
					
					 The performers include international and national concours winners, celebrated artistes, students and children. 
					
					 The performance will take place at May Day Stadium in Pyongyang from August 1 to September 9.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Off Press
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Off Press
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 95 of "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works", a library of the Juche idea which comprehensively carries his works in a chronological order. 
					 The book contains Vol. 1 of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century".
					
					 It deals with the revolutionary activities he conducted until May 1930 after being born in Mangyongdae on April 15, 1912.

articles.title: Ultraviolet-intercepting Skin Cream
articles.content:
Ultraviolet-intercepting Skin Cream 
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The Unhasu-trademarked facial cream enjoys popularity among people in the DPRK. 
					 The cream, produced by the Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory, absorbs or disperses ultraviolet wave adversely affecting skin. 
					
					 According to experts, the cream prevents sunburn, erythema, blister and other skin diseases.
					
					 It also keeps skin humid and prevents aging, while giving no side effect.

articles.title: Blue-collar Writer Ri Kwang Suk
articles.content:
Blue-collar Writer Ri Kwang Suk 
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A Russian singer received an enthusiastic applause from the audience by singing the Korean song "Girls Riding on Galloping Steeds" in the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival held in Pyongyang this year.
					 The song mirrors the worthwhile life of girls making a good job of their work.
					
					 It, one of the popular songs in Korea, is also well known to south Korean people, overseas Koreans and foreigners.
					
					 The song was written by Ri Kwang Suk, a machine operator at the Sinuiju Cosmetics Factory.
					
					 Born into a worker's family as eldest daughter, she enjoyed the 11-year compulsory education.
					
					 She, with a literary bent, won the "Our Classroom" literary prize in her school days.
					
					 After graduating from secondary school, she began working with the factory, while writing poems in her spare hours.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il, when visiting the exhibition of educational materials held to mark the 8th Congress of the League of Socialist Working Youth in February Juche 82 (1993), read her works and extended thanks to her. 
					
					 Encouraged by his thanks, she has continued writing fine works.

articles.title: US Termed Chief Culprit of New Arms Race
articles.content:
US Termed Chief Culprit of New Arms Race
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The U.S. frequently claims that it is "interested" in global peace and stability, but its deeds do not agree with such assertion, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined commentary.
					 This is evidenced by the fact that the U.S. is pushing forward the moves to build the missile defense system and modernize nuclear weapons contrary to world peace and stability, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 Recently the director of the U.S. CIA said that the MD system to be built by the U.S. should be reinforced in terms of quality and quantity, asserting that this would not affect the maintenance of strategic stability. The U.S. announced a plan to invest 4 billion dollars in updating nuclear bombs of B-61 type as a scheme to modernize old nuclear bombs deployed in European countries.
					
					 World peace and stability are incompatible with military reinforcement and modernization of war equipment.
					
					 What the U.S. seeks in modernizing war equipment is to hold absolute military upper-hand in the international arena and expand the sphere of its domination worldwide on its basis.
					
					 Such anti-peace moves will fan up worldwide arms race and military confrontation and screw up the international situation.
					
					 With no deceptive tricks can the U.S. conceal its true colors as the chief culprit in wrecking global peace and stability and sparking off a new arms race.
					
					 The U.S. should stop a poor drama and discontinue its anti-peace action at once.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Minister's Remarks Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Minister's Remarks Flailed
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Hyon In Thaek, puppet minister of Unification of south Korea, slandered the DPRK with outcries for "provocation" and "political offensive going beyond the common sense and practice". He also called again for "reform and opening".
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Monday terms his remarks shameless sophism to shift the blame for the deteriorated inter-Korean relations on to the DPRK and get out of dilemma.
					
					 Hyon is not qualified to talk about "common sense and practice", the commentary says, adding:
					
					 The south Korean warmongers made a target daring hurt the dignity of the nation's leadership and fired at it, an act that cannot be made with common sense.
					
					 There were good practices between the north and the south in the past. Whenever they were in difficulties, they helped with each other as the homogenous nation, and whenever disputes cropped up, they showed magnanimity and understanding to get reconciled with each other.
					
					 But, Hyon has abandoned this tradition. It is ridiculous for him to call for "reform and opening" while pretending to do the good for someone. With such call he can never conceal his insidious intention to win "unification of systems".
					
					 He is advised to mind the ailing economy of south Korea, before admonishing others, and open the closed door to visits between NGOs in the north and the south.
					
					 He has already been branded as a political corpse for the hideous crimes he committed against the country and the nation. Such guy is working hard to shirk the blame for the deteriorated inter-Korean relations, provoking other over "provocation" and "political offensive", but it will bring nothing.
					
					 He would be well advised not to strain his nerves on unwanted things but take care of himself.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Glorifying WPK's Feats for Advance of Great Surge
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Glorifying WPK's Feats for Advance of Great Surge
						
Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The Korean army and people should give spurs of fresh leap to the ongoing general offensive for opening the gate to a thriving nation, taking the feats of General Secretary Kim Jong Il performed in guiding the advance for great surge as a treasured sword.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday made this call in a bylined article today.
					
					 The feats of the Workers' Party of Korea performed in leading the advance for great surge are valuable asset that makes it possible to build a thriving country in the shortest period and guarantees happiness of not only the present generation but also all generations to come, the article said, adding:
					
					 It is needed for the present generation and posterity to ensure the work for displaying the great vitality of the said exploits. The eternal prosperity of the Korean nation lies in reliably defending and glorifying the WPK's feats to the full.
					
					 Today our army and people are working hard to honor the leadership feats of the Party, regarding this work as top priority.
					
					 In the DPRK a more vigorous drive is being conducted to generalize and popularize in the whole society the successes and experience gained under the leadership of the WPK. 
					
					 The Korean people strive to make higher leap and faster progress in reliance on the WPK's leadership exploits. 
					
					 The present gigantic advance for great surge shows that signal creativity is needed to exalt the brilliance of the Party's leadership feats. 
					
					 Now is the present era of knowledge-based economy and only person with rich intelligence can serve to glorify the exploits. 
					
					 It is hard to make leap only in the revolutionary spirit without displaying high creativity. To acquire both the revolutionary spirit and creativity is a fundamental guarantee for successfully preserving the Party's exploits. 
					
					 The Korean people's course of building a thriving nation tells that the work to defend and honor the Party's leadership feats should be consistently carried out through generations and ages. 
					
					 This work to exalt the leadership feats of the Party and the leader can be done only by those with the firm faith will to go along the road indicated by the Party and accomplish the cause launched by the forerunners through generations to come.
					
					 As the present generation remembers the feats performed by those in the Chollima era, our posterity will keep forever the valuable truth of revolution proved in the Songun era of great surge, the article concludes.

articles.title: Facts about US Attempted Use of A-bombs during Korean War Disclosed
articles.content:
Facts about US Attempted Use of A-bombs during Korean War Disclosed
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Yonhap News on June 23 opened to pubic the diary of the then commander of the U.S. Air Force in the Far East, which attested that the U.S. imperialists attempted to use atomic bombs in the early days of the Korean War.
					 According to it, at that time the operation research office of the U.S. Department of the Army made a concrete analysis into the tactical use of A-bombs in ground close support operation from September 1950.
					
					 Contained in the diary is the fact that a doctor affiliated to the office surveyed the war theatre on December 1 that year in a purpose to inform the commander of the U.S. Far East Command of the results of analysis into possibility and effect of using A-bombs in real action.
					
					 Reporting about the facts, Yonhap News said this shows that the U.S. examined closely the possible use of nuclear weapons in the Korean War.
					
					 Such attempt of the U.S. imperialists was proven through the facts that the then U.S. president, Truman, told reporters his administration was always examining the use of A-bombs, that Commander of the U.S. Far East Command MacArthur told about the plan to drop dozens of A-bombs over DPRK-China border areas and that the U.S. nuclear weapons were deployed in south Korea in mid-August 1950, according to Yonhap News.

articles.title: All-People Action against "Government" Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
All-People Action against "Government" Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean preparatory committee for the People's Strength for New Society held a press conference at the Kwanghwamun plaza in Seoul on June 24 in  demand of wage hike and reduction of school registration fee by half.
					 At the conference speakers censured the Lee Myung Bak "government" for having deteriorated the people's livelihood by pursuing the unpopular rule in disregard of their demands.
					
					 Such wrongdoings can not be allowed any longer, they said, declaring that they would stage an all-people resistance to punish the traitorous regime.
					
					 Then a press release was read out.
					
					 Since the present "government" emerged many workers have been reduced to part-time workers and the unemployed has increased among university graduates and thereby the people's life has been seriously deteriorated, it deplored.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak "government" is to blame for this, it said, urging the authorities to accept the urgent demands of the people for hike of the minimum wage and reduction of registration fee by half.
					
					 At the end of the conference its participants marched to Chongwadae to hand a written protest.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by S. Korean Student
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by S. Korean Student
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A student of Seoul University posted on an Internet homepage an article praising General Secretary Kim Jong Il on June 19.
					 In an article headlined "Long live the great general, my only father!" he expressed his earnest wish to come over to the embrace of General Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Juche idea is, indeed, the great guiding idea which would save the world, he said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Finnish Organization, Ukrainian University
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Finnish Organization, Ukrainian University
Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A Finnish organization and a Ukrainian university posted special write-ups on their Internet homepages with photos on General Secretary Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities. They were to mark the 47th anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea in an article on June 13 said Kim Jong Il's visit to China was a great event which greatly contributed not only to the development of the DPRK-China friendly relations but to the peace and security in Northeast Asia.
					
					 He has thoroughly applied the Juche idea authored by President Kim Il Sung to the party building and activities, regarding it as the fixed guiding idea of the party since he started the work at the WPK Central Committee, the article said.
					
					 The WPK will demonstrate its might as the invincible party as it is led by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, it noted.
					
					 Poltava City University of Agriculture of Ukraine in an article on June 14 praised the feats by Kim Il Sung for the development of the vinalon industry.
					
					 The February 8 Vinalon Complex, which was built as the vinalon industrial base under the care of Kim Il Sung, has brought a great pleasure to the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the article noted.
					
					 Another article of the homepage introduced the DPRK making great efforts to ensure formative and artistic characteristics of structures.

articles.title: Russian Organization Supports Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Russian Organization Supports Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The Karelia Branch of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK released a statement on June 19 to mark the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the month of international solidarity with the Korean people.
					 The organization said June 15 this year marks the 11th anniversary of the historic joint declaration, adding it opened a way to realize the desire of the Korean nation for independent reunification, peace and prosperity.
					
					 The statement continued:
					
					 The conservative authorities of south Korea, however, worked against the reunification in collusion with foreign forces. They scuttled the inter-Korean dialogues through military provocations against the DPRK and prevented the unity of the nation.
					
					 We are convinced that justice and peace would win a victory on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We call on the progressive people in the world to extend support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just struggle to achieve peace and reunification by implementing the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration on the occasion of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people.
					
					 We support the DPRK in its efforts for peace and stability in Northeast Asia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised in Different Countries
Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A meeting and film shows took place in Democratic Congo and Poland on June 10 and 14 on the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Korean films shown included "Korean People's Army, Steel-Strong Ranks" and "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".
					
					 Kim Jong Il has energetically worked to develop the Party into the revolutionary party of Juche, the eternal party of President Kim Il Sung from the first day of his work at the WPK Central Committee, said the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo.
					
					 The politics of love for the people, the politics of unity and independence pursued by Kim Jong Il is a political mode which the parties of all countries should learn, he added.
					
					 The chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association noted Kim Jong Il is a distinguished political elder who has led the WPK from long ago.
					
					 It is a fruition of Kim Jong Il's leadership that the WPK could develop into the party absolutely supported and trusted by the people while maintaining its principle despite all storm and stress, he stressed.
					
					 The chairman of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association said the Korean people would surely overcome all trials and difficulties and fling open the gate to a thriving nation as they are led by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the event in Democratic Congo.
					
					 Meanwhile, a Mongolian newspaper and Lao radio and TV broadcasting carried special write-ups and televised a Korean film on June 17 on the same occasion.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Austrian Organization
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Austrian Organization
Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna issued a bulletin on June 19, the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The bulletin carried an article with his portrait.
					
					 From the first day of his start of work at the WPK Central Committee Kim Jong Il made sure that the monolithic ideology and leadership systems of President Kim Il Sung were firmly established within the party, the article said.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 Kim Jong Il has led the overall work of the party, the army and the state with his gifted savvy and qualifications.
					
					 Socialism collapsed in some countries but the DPRK has firmly defended it as the WPK has thoroughly applied the Juche idea to the revolution and construction.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are united close around their leader in one mind.
					
					 The DPRK has turned into a military power under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The WPK is an invincible revolutionary party led by him.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised Abroad
Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Lectures took place in Italy and Indonesia and film shows in Ethiopia between June 8 and 17 in celebration of the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and his successful visit to China.
					 Participants in the film shows watched Korean films including "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Arms of Korea".
					
					 Kim Jong Il has developed the WPK into the party of President Kim Il Sung and invincible and revolutionary party, said the chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Songun Idea in Fermo of Italy.
					
					 The Korean people have achieved great successes in building a thriving nation frustrating the moves of the imperialists against socialism true to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il, he added.
					
					 We will positively wage the solidarity activities supporting the Korean people in their drive to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country in the future, too, he stressed.
					
					 The president of Indonesian company Dwi Mitra Perkasa praised the party building exploits of Kim Jong Il, saying the WPK would demonstrate its might as an ever-victorious party in the future, too, as it is led by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 An official of the Ethiopian Ministry of Health said Kim Jong Il's visit to China was a historic visit which demonstrated the might of the DPRK to the world, adding the party and the state of the DPRK are invincible as they are led by Kim Jong Il, a man of far-sighted wisdom and seasoned leadership ability.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Website
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Website
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on June 22 posted on its Internet website the gist of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Prevent a National Partition and Reunify the Country".
					 The work, published on June 23, Juche 62 (1973), indicates an independent and peaceful reunification policy of the Workers' Party of Korea and the government of the DPRK.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Japan
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- A 6.7-magnitude earthquake hit Tohoku area of Japan on June 23.
					 The epicenter was waters off Iwate Prefecture.

articles.title: Okinawa Leaders Slam Japan-US Deal on Futenma Base
articles.content:
Okinawa Leaders Slam Japan-US Deal on Futenma Base
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Local leaders in Okinawa Prefecture vented their anger against the central government on Wednesday as Japan reaffirmed with the United States a controversial plan to relocate a key U.S. base within the prefecture.
					 "It is virtually impossible to deliver a relocation plan that cannot gain the acceptance of the local people," said the governor of Okinawa.
					
					 He called on the central government to relocate the U.S. Marine Corps' Futenma Air Station out of the prefecture.
					
					 The mayor of Ginowan said "The Japanese government is only looking at the United States in the negotiations."

articles.title: Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesman on Japan-US Alliance
articles.content:
Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesman on Japan-US Alliance
 Beijing, June 26 (KCNA) -- Hong Lei, a spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of China, said in a press conference on June 23 that the Japan-U.S. alliance should not go beyond the scope of bilateral category.
					 Recently the Japan-U.S. Security Consultative Committee urged in a joint statement that China should play a responsible role in ensuring regional stability.
					
					 In this regard, Hong said that China keeps the road of peaceful development and enforces the military policy for defensive purposes while striving to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with different countries, its neighboring countries in particular. 
					
					 China hopes that the countries concerned would respect this reality, take a responsible attitude and do a lot of things beneficial to preserving regional peace and stability and deepening mutual trust, he said.

articles.title: Serial Performance for Anniversary of CPC Closes in China
articles.content:
Serial Performance for Anniversary of CPC Closes in China
 Beijing, June 26 (KCNA) -- Serial performance for commemoration of the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China came to close at the Grand Theater of the National Cultural Palace in Beijing on June 19.
					 Its programs consisted of numbers prepared in different regions associated with the brilliant revolutionary traditions. All of them deal with the glorious history of the CPC.

articles.title: Attempt to Downplay Russia's Role in WW II Denounced: PM
articles.content:
Attempt to Downplay Russia's Role in WW II Denounced: PM
 Moscow, June 26 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin at a recent meeting denounced the attempt to distort history by some countries.
					 Those countries are trying to downplay the role played by the Soviet Union in defeating the Nazi Germany, he said, criticizing the attempt to distort the results of World War II. Russia should maintain a principled and strong stand on it, he emphasized.
					
					 All the people should bear in mind that the distortion of history may entail serious consequences, he noted, calling on them not to forget heroism and feats performed by their fathers and grandfathers.

articles.title: Russia Rejects West's Accusation
articles.content:
Russia Rejects West's Accusation
 Moscow, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of Russia in a statement on June 23 rejected the West's accusation over the work of registering political parties in the country.
					 The statement dismissed as groundless some Western politicians' accusations against Russia over the fact that the Party of People's Freedom's registration in the state list of political parties was rejected in the country.
					
					 The decision to vote down its registration was adopted strictly under the Russian law in force, it said.

articles.title: Taliban Urges Pullout of All Foreign Troops from Afghanistan
articles.content:
Taliban Urges Pullout of All Foreign Troops from Afghanistan
						
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Taliban of Afghanistan in a statement on June 23 urged full withdrawal of all foreign troops from the country.
					 Recently U.S. President Obama laid out his plans for Afghanistan troops drawdown. The statement dismissed the plans as a trick to deceive public opinion.
					
					 The U.S. does not respect the demand of the Afghanistan people hoping for an end to the war and occupation, it said, adding that Taliban would increase its armed struggle until all foreign troops are completely withdrawn.

articles.title: US Forces' Plan to Deploy New Arms Equipment Opposed
articles.content:
US Forces' Plan to Deploy New Arms Equipment Opposed
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The Ginowan City Assembly in Okinawa Prefecture adopted a resolution Wednesday urging cancellation of the U.S. plan to deploy MV-22 Osprey vertical takeoff and landing aircraft at the U.S. base in the city.
					 The resolution expressed concerns about the aircraft's safety as the aircraft "have been involved in a number of fatal crashes" during test flights.
					
					 The strengthening of the functions of the Futenma facility by the Osprey deployment would lead to the "fixation" of the Futenma base in its present form, it said.
					
					 The resolution urged both the Japanese and the U.S. governments to shut down the base as soon as possible.

articles.title: Forest Fires Burn 145,600 Acres in Texas, US
articles.content:
Forest Fires Burn 145,600 Acres in Texas, US
						
Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Seventeen forest fires spotted in Texas as of June 22 burned about 145,600 acres of forest and destroyed more than 20 houses.

articles.title: Argentina Seizes 955 kg of Cocaine
articles.content:
Argentina Seizes 955 kg of Cocaine 
Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- Argentine police confiscated 955 kg of cocaine and arrested drug traffickers in the border area of Salta Province.

articles.title: World Refugees Number 43.7 Million
articles.content:
World Refugees Number 43.7 Million 
						
 Pyongyang, June 27 (KCNA) -- The number of refugees worldwide reached 43.7 million last year, according to a recent UN report.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegación china
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegación china
Pyongyang, 27 de junio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibió presente que le dedicara la delegación del partido y el gobierno de la provincia de Liaoning de China presidida por Chen Zhenggao, subsecretario del Comité Provincial del Partido Comunista de China en Liaoning y gobernador del gobierno popular de la misma provincia, de visita en Corea.
					  El jefe de la delegación lo entregó el día 27 a Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buró Político del Comité Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y premier del Consejo de Ministros de la República Popular Democrática de Corea.

articles.title: Taekwondo de Corea llama atención de estadounidenses
articles.content:
Taekwondo de Corea llama atención de estadounidenses
Pyongyang, 27 de junio (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el grupo de demostración del Comité de Taekwondo de Corea visitó Estados Unidos.
					  El grupo ofreció los días 11 y 12 su actuación modelo en Boston y Nueva York y el día 14 en Delaware ganando efusivas ovaciones de ciudadanos estadounidenses y coreanos radicados en EE.UU.
					
					  La VOA transmitió que cada vez que los taekwondoistas demostraban varias habilidades de arte marcial, los espectadores les dieron aplausos.
					
					  Aclaró que la demostración hacía imaginar algunas escenas de película y repercutió mucho entre los ciudadanos de distintos sectores y alumnos de EE.UU.
					
					   Taekwondo de Corea, que refleja la inteligencia y valentía de la nación coreana, provocó un fervor de aprenderlo entre los habitantes de distintos sectores de EE.UU., aseveró.
					
					  Además, transmitió las intervenciones de los  taekwondoistas coreanos y reportó que la visita de este grupo coreano a EE.UU. llamó gran atención de CNN y otros medios de prensa de EE.UU., Japón y el Sur de Corea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia a EE.UU por su carrera armamentista
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia a EE.UU por su carrera armamentista
Pyongyang, 27 de junio (ATCC) -- Estados Unidos finge tener interés en la paz y la estabilidad del mundo, pero, en práctica actúa al contrario.
					Lo prueba sólo el hecho de que el imperio acelera con frenesí el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles y la modernización de las armas nucleares contraproducentes con la paz y la estabilidad del mundo.
					
					Así señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este lunes y continúa:
					
					Recientemente, el director de CIA dijo que el sistema antimisiles de EE.UU. "no afectaría al mantenimiento de la estabilidad estratégica" y subrayó que debe aumentarlo en el sentido cualitativo y cuantitativo.
					
					EE.UU. publicó el plan de invertir 4 mil millones de US$ a la modernización de la bomba nuclear de tipo "B-61", una de las bombas nucleares viejas distribuidas en los países europeos.
					
					La paz y la estabilidad del mundo son incompatibles con el aumento armamentista y la modernización de los equipos bélicos.
					
					EE.UU. hace esfuerzos frenéticos por  modernizarlos a fin de tomar la absoluta supremacía militar en la escena internacional y a base de esto, ampliar la esfera de dominio mundial.
					
					Esto estimula la carrera armamentista mundial y la confrontación militar y agrava la situación internacional.
					
					Con ninguna artimaña, EE.UU. puede ocultar la naturaleza criminal de autor de nueva carrera armamentista que destruya la paz y la estabilidad del mundo.
					
					El imperio debe poner de inmediato fin a sus actos antipacíficos.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun demanda abolición de "ley de seguridad" en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun demanda abolición de "ley de seguridad" en Sur de Corea 
Pyongyang, 27 de junio (ATCC) -- Si la banda de Lee Myung Bak sigue negando la abolición de la infame "ley de seguridad" y aferrándose a la confrontación fratricida con la invención de la "ley de DDHH del Norte" pese a la fuerte demanda del interior y exterior del país, no podrá evadir el arruinamiento. 
					Señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un artículo individual del día 26 y prosigue:
					
					Durante más de 60 años, los sucesivos gobernantes surcoreanos utilizaron la "ley de seguridad" como un medio para asegurar la "seguridad de gobernación" y violar los derechos humanos. 
					
					 Esta infame ley, sin precedente en la historia tanto en su curso de invención como en su modificación peor, es la fascista que viola despiadadamente la democracia y los derechos humanos y sirve de medio principal para el mantenimiento del "poder" y del sistema dictatorial del actual "gobierno" conservador. 
					
					La abolición de la "ley de seguridad" es una tarea apremiante en el Sur de Corea. 
					
					Sin embargo, la banda de Lee Myung Bak instituyó una sección para tratar especialmente los casos de violación de dicha ley, diciendo que es una cosa "prematura" la abolición de esta legislación y reprime a troche y moche a las entidades y habitantes que luchan por la reconciliación y unidad nacionales y la reunificación de la patria.
					
					Lo que no se puede pasar por alto es que la banda de Lee Myung Bak se entrega a la fabricación de la "ley de DDHH del Norte" cuestionando atrevidamente el estado de "derechos humanos" de alguien, lejos de tratar los graves casos de violación de DDHH de sí misma que se comenten en virtud de esa infame ley.
					
					Tal hecho muestra qué fanáticas son las maniobras de la banda de Lee tendentes a hacer enfrentamiento con los connacionales y a lograr la ambición de la "reunificación de sistemas".
